text.p: French construction company Bouygues aims to grow in 1997 and the coming years in the building and services sectors, chairman Martin Bouygues said on Monday.

The company is particularly looking to expand internationally in the construction business, he told a news conference. As for France, "the crisis in building and public works is exceptionally long and deep but it will not last forever," he said.
Bouygues expects 1997 group turnover to total 85.7 billion francs, versus 82.6 billion in 1996, of which 59.3 billion will come from construction, compared to 60.64 billion.

Building and public works 1997 turnover will total 31.25 billion francs, of which 16.6 billion will come from France and 14.65 billion internationally. That compares to a total 32.12 billion for 1996, with 18.81 billion domestically and 13.31 billion in foreign markets in the previous year.

Services, which represent 28 percent of sales, is expected to see significant expansion in the coming years, he said, but gave no figures. "That is where we will see significant growth, and we believe, our profits," he said.
Services are expected to contribute 24.1 billion francs in sales this year, compared to 18.85 billion in 1996.
